Files ready for proofreading may be uploaded here. Once uploaded, Authors and other participants assigned to the submission may be asked to audit the uploaded proofreading file(s) by clicking the Assign button. Multiple files may be sent for auditing, and an auditing due date can be set. You will be notified of completed audits, and can access the audits by clicking on the participant's name. To ensure the integrity of the blind peer-review for submission to this press, every effort should be made to prevent the identities of the authors and reviewers from being known to each other. This involves the authors, editors, and reviewers (who upload documents as part of their review) checking to see if the following steps have been taken with regard to the text and the file properties:

  • The authors of the document have deleted their names from the text, with "Author" and year used in the references and footnotes, instead of the authors' name, article title, etc.
  • With Microsoft Office documents, author identification should also be removed from the properties for the file (see under File in Word), by clicking on the following, beginning with File on the main menu of the Microsoft application: File > Save As > Tools (or Options with a Mac) > Security > Remove personal information from file properties on save > Save.
  • With PDFs, the authors' names should also be removed from Document Properties found under File on Adobe Acrobat's main menu.

Welcome to Catalog Management. From this page you can publish new catalog entries; review and configure your Featured Books listing; review and configure your New Releases listing; and review and configure your books by Category and Series.

To list the submission in the public catalog, acknowledge that the submission is ready to appear in the Monograph tab. If publicly publishing different book formats (eg. hardback; softback/paperback; digital; audio), acknowledge that each publication format is ready to be included in the public catalog in the individual publication format tab, and ensure that the publication format's direct sales availability & pricing is configured. Additional information (including cover image, audience, representatives, and so on) can be configured in the Catalog tab.

Recommended system requirements

  • PHP >= {$phpRequiredVersion} (including PHP 5.x); you are currently using PHP {$phpVersion}{$wrongPhpText}
  • MySQL >= 3.23.23 (including MySQL 4.x) or PostgreSQL >= 7.1 (including PostgreSQL 8.x)

Changes to these settings can be made after installation by editing the file config.inc.php in the base OMP directory, or using the site administration web interface.

Supported database systems

OMP has currently only been tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL, although other database management systems supported by ADOdb may work (in full or partially). Compatibility reports and/or code patches for alternative DBMSs can be sent to the OMP team.

Pre-Installation Steps

1. The following files and directories (and their contents) must be made writable:

  • config.inc.php is writable (optional): {$writable_config}
  • public/ is writable: {$writable_public}
  • cache/ is writable: {$writable_cache}
  • cache/t_cache/ is writable: {$writable_templates_cache}
  • cache/t_compile/ is writable: {$writable_templates_compile}
  • cache/_db is writable: {$writable_db_cache}

2. A directory to store uploaded files must be created and made writable (see "File Settings" below).
